ratings.comment:
Overall good professor, makes a lot of jokes and is ready to help.
I did found the tests to be sometimes a bit tougher than older ones. I practiced a lot using these, and there were always some problems with an extra twist (in terms of concepts however, it was always standard).
For me, this was the fine line between a good and a not-so-good grade.

Dr. Gustafson is one of the nicest professors I have ever had. He is an extremely nice guy, and I cannot recommend him more. The issues with the calculus sequence stem from the math department itself, such as the insane exam weighting. He does a great job explaining things in office hours, and all of his lecture slides are posted to canvas.
Phil is an amazing professor. He is extremely caring to his students and makes a true effort to make his lectures engaging and enjoyable.
He always stayed after class to answer tons of questions. Very open with what will be on tests and how to succeed. I highly recommend him if you have to take Math 171.

Dr. Gustafson was a decent professor for Math171. You can tell he cares a lot about math and his students. He can sometimes be unclear on important concepts, and tends to skip over important problem types. Overall, if you have a little calculus background, Dr. Phil would be a great professor for you.

Professor Gustafson is a very nice guy and clearly cares about his students. His teaching was a bit hard to follow in my opinion... he would get lost in his own notes during lectures. Students had to correct him multiple times. If you have a basic knowledge of calc before taking the course, though, you will be completely fine. His tests were easy.

He's nice and pretty good at explaining concepts, although if you zone out for a few seconds you'll be totally lost. He tells awful dad jokes, which some people find cringe, but I enjoy. He's a little quiet so I recommend sitting in the front if possible.

His teaching style was something to adjust to... but he has many examples in his notes and stresses that the notes are better for studying than the practice exams. He doesn't write the practice exams so it was difficult to know if that was fully what was on the exam

Phil is a SUPER nice guy, but not the best professor. His notes are a good depiction of the test, but you have to teach the material to yourself. He tends to start a new unit within the last 5 min. of class which is very frustrating.  His tests are not too difficult, and as long as you dedicate time to teaching yourself you will be okay.

Great professor who starts lectures with jokes to make kids more comfortable. The class was heavily weighted on the exams, as every math class is, so the homework assignments were more just practice problems. He responds fast and provides good feedback on difficult problems. Would gladly take more classes with him.

Dr. Gustafson is a nice guy, but not a great teacher. His lectures are boring - he just reads the slides and sometimes doesn't even do the work (slides are pre-filled in). I stopped going to class and taught myself the material. Exams aren't bad though if you study.
Too great of an emphasis on exams, providing limited review resources/time for review/unhelpful review materials, and unhelpful TAs. Unholy trinity.

He is a very nice person, but not the best at teaching.He is way better at teaching one on one after class in his office hours.If you go to his office hours he will tell you what to expect on the exam.If you want an A, just practice the problems on his lecture slides. Also, it is an easy class if you have taken calc before.

Phil Gustafson is, simply, not a good instructor. He spends more time trying to make the class like him than teaching the material. After being made to take his midterm with a 103-degree fever, I asked him if there was anything I could do to make up the exam and I was told I "shouldn't have been sick. He will not help you individually.

He is a new professor on campus but he is amazing. If you don't understand something go ask him after class, Start the lecture with dad jokes. He does make a lot of mistakes when trying to explain problems and trails off in thought when doing them which can make it hard to follow along. If you do have some calc background you'll be fine
